intro: Cephalaria squamiflora var. ebusitana, commonly known as the Ebusi cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grayish-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or clay soils. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and specialized horticulture.
